author: Junior Skepple
title: CSX announces 1,000 layoffs, a majority of which will impact Jacksonville, FL., employees - Jacksonville Business Journal
text: CSX train. TBJ File Photo CSX Corp. announced today it will be laying off 1,000 management positions, mostly in Jacksonville, according to an email sent to the Business Journal's news partner, FirstCoast News. CSX's announcement (NASDAQ: CSX) comes as a part of the company's involuntary separation program which will be completed in March. CSX train. TBJ File Photo There are 2,500 management employees in Jacksonville that may be affected, but to what extent this move affects local employees will not be known until an organization review is completed. The company announced enhanced separation benefits are being extended to employees impacted by the layoffs. As of press time, CSX has not filed a notice with the state concerning it's latest rounds of layoffs. This announcement comes on the heels of CEO Michael Ward 's impending departure from the railroad company amid a hostile takeover.
